Sentencas: Steam electrolysis for hydrogen production is investigated in solid oxide electrolysis cell (SOEC).
Titulo: Comparison of ceria and zirconia based electrolytes for solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: Sc3+, Ce4+, and Gd3+ are doped in zirconia (SCGZ) and compared with yttria stabilized zirconia (YSZ) and gadolinium doped ceria (GDC) electrolyte.
Titulo: Comparison of ceria and zirconia based electrolytes for solid oxide electrolysis cells
Comparison of ceria and zirconia based electrolytes for solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: The SCGZ and YSZ electrolytes are dense with >95% relative density while GDC is less densified.
Titulo: Comparison of ceria and zirconia based electrolytes for solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: The activation energy of conduction of the SCGZ electrolyte is the lowest at 65.58 kJ mol-1
Titulo: Comparison of ceria and zirconia based electrolytes for solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: although phase transformation is detected after electrolyte fabrication process.
Titulo: Comparison of ceria and zirconia based electrolytes for solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: Cathode-supported cell having SCGZ electrolyte (Ni-SCGZ/SCGZ/BSCF) shows the highest electrochemical performance.
Titulo: Comparison of ceria and zirconia based electrolytes for solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: Durability test of the cells in electrolysis mode is carried out over 60 h (0.3 A cm -2, 1073 K, H2O to H2 ratio of 70:30).
Titulo: Comparison of ceria and zirconia based electrolytes for solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: Significant performance degradation of Ni-GDC/YSZ/GDC/BSCF cell is observed (0.0057 V h-1) whereas the performance of Ni-YSZ/YSZ/BSCF and Ni-SCGZ/SCGZ/BSCF are rather stable under the same operating conditions.
Titulo: Comparison of ceria and zirconia based electrolytes for solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: The BSCF remains attaching to the SCGZ electrolyte and additional phase transformation is not observed after prolong operation.
Titulo: Comparison of ceria and zirconia based electrolytes for solid oxide electrolysis cells
